topic.title: Ethernet Interfaces
topic.shortdesc: Ethernet interfaces, both physical and virtual, play a key role in the overall performance of the virtualized network. Therefore, it is important to understand the available interface types, their configuration options, and their impact on network design.

section.title: About LAG/AE Interfaces
section.p: To provide link protection, Ethernet interfaces in a LAG group can be attached either to the same L2 switch, or to multiple switches in a redundant configuration. For more information about L2 switch configurations, see . For information about the different LAG modes, see the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Software Installation Guide.
